cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles east of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the northeast Caribbean, brushing Puerto Rico and then heading toward the Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas, and later Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal encounter near or just north of Puerto Rico (San Juan area) late Wed, then potential landfall Turks & Caicos / SE Bahamas late Thu

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuba from Matanzas province eastward to Guantanamo province and the Central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), U.S. & British Virgin Islands, N coast of Dominican Republic to Le Mole St. Nicholas Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and the SE Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern coast of Puerto Rico and adjacent islands, extending west toward Hispaniola
weather_observation.wind: Extremely dangerous hurricane-force winds possible with sustained speeds 110-140+ mph and higher gusts as the core passes just north
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft above ground possible along the northern coast of Puerto Rico including San Juan, accompanied by large destructive waves
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–10 inches with isolated 15 inches; life-threatening flash flooding and mudslides possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; possible port infrastructure damage from debris and wave action
